alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Grant; Kay; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 1:38AM CDT until June 06 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma and northern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Payne. In northern Oklahoma, Garfield, Grant, Kay and Noble. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 138 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stillwater, Perry, Tonkawa, Yale, Garber, Morrison, Glencoe, Billings, Lamont, Red Rock, Marland, Hunter, Lake Mcmurtry, Sooner Lake, Lake Carl Blackwell, Lucien, Quay, Ceres and Ingalls. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
